Posted By: Stuflames (10/12/2013 9:15:29 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I like both artworks.  
  
The old one is colorful and immediately recognizable as "that particular damn doll".  
But this one looks just as remarkable, and *very* sinister. On top of that it is depicted as animate here,  
which does make sense since it can attack. Which just adds to the creepyness factor.  
  
Also, for any of you out there who already maniacally laugh when they cast [Pariah](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pariah) on this:  
Consider running [Tarnished Citadel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tarnished Citadel). It has a ridiculously high toll of 3 damage for producing mana of any color -  
and your opponent will get a taste of that! And it can be easily done by just switching out some of your basic lands.  
Even if you're running a monocolored deck, the damage output you get each turn through this painland is marvellous:  
[Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=234704) your opponent *while producing mana* - now that's something!
posts.html:
I like both artworks.

The old one is colorful and immediately recognizable as "that particular damn doll".
But this one looks just as remarkable, and very sinister. On top of that it is depicted as animate here,
which does make sense since it can attack. Which just adds to the creepyness factor.

Also, for any of you out there who already maniacally laugh when they cast Pariah on this:
Consider running Tarnished Citadel. It has a ridiculously high toll of 3 damage for producing mana of any color -
and your opponent will get a taste of that! And it can be easily done by just switching out some of your basic lands.
Even if you're running a monocolored deck, the damage output you get each turn through this painland is marvellous:
Bolt your opponent while producing mana - now that's something!

Posted By: Zinitiate (9/6/2013 1:51:59 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@ orisiti   
  
For 99.9% of situations your answer to the trample question is correct. However, for whatever reason that opponent can choose to have any amount of damage more than lethal be dealt to the stuff doll.  
  
Trample is a MAY, you don't have to trample over if you don't want to.  
  
  
A scenario where this might be a good choice is if the stuff doll is choosing someone other than the player who is attacking you. It may be optimal to have that damage go to the other player, if they are a bigger threat in that game.
posts.html:
@ orisiti

For 99.9% of situations your answer to the trample question is correct. However, for whatever reason that opponent can choose to have any amount of damage more than lethal be dealt to the stuff doll.

Trample is a MAY, you don't have to trample over if you don't want to.


A scenario where this might be a good choice is if the stuff doll is choosing someone other than the player who is attacking you. It may be optimal to have that damage go to the other player, if they are a bigger threat in that game.
